pageContext.claim: “And our economy, as you know, has surged from where it is when I took it over. We were having an economy that was going in the wrong direction.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. When Trump took office, he inherited an economy that has been in an upward trend for several years. The economy experienced a seven year streak of job growth, the unemployment rate had been declining since 2011, GDP growth had topped 3 percent on a quarterly basis, the poverty rate has been declining since 2013, and median household income increased in 2015 and 2016.
